Reviews.Title: Not fully functional
Reviews.Author: seriously
Reviews.Content: Sd card not recognized. Earphones/ wired headset does not work.  Works with the exception of that.  HArd to navigate on screen

Reviews.Title: Good idea but poor quality
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: It's a great idea, very convenient but it's made with very bad materials. I had the watch-phone for three weeks and I was fine with the quality of sound and everything but suddenly, the battery case split in two by itself, it looks like the factory glue dry out. Also the blue-tooth headset stopped working. It's not worth the money if it is made to last for three weeks.

Reviews.Title: Great, but not for people who want a full featured smart phone.
Reviews.Author: Unknown.usr "corpbot"
Reviews.Content: This is a great device for people who want something handy with the ability to access minimal internet sites.  It is not a full featured phone, but it is excellent for what it is.The phone works great, even without the headset.  The menus are much easier than previous Chinese watch/phones I have used.  However, teh web browser is burried in the settings menu, which is strange.  And even after I configured the default language settings, I still get Google in Chinese.  I am still figuring out how to setup email.Here is how to setup the WAP browser for AT&T;, in case anyone is hunting for these settings:Go to menu, settings, data account, options, add. Name is AT&T; (or whatever you want). APN is set to "WAP.CINGULAR".  User name & password are blank. Auth type, left at normal. Primary & secondary DNS, left at all zeros.Go to menu, settings, Internet service, settings,  profiles, add new. Profile name is AT&T; (or whatever you want), home page I used is [...], data account is AT&T; (or whatever you named it), connection type is http, Proxy Address is "wireless.cingular.com", Proxy port is "80". Leave user name & password blank.

Reviews.Title: Appropriate for knowledgeable Buyers
Reviews.Author: K. X. Youkai
Reviews.Content: If you have never programmed or dealt with unlocked communication/data devices, I recommend finding a friend/consultant before buying so you can take full advantage of this device.When properly programmed it is a FANTASTIC alternative to clunky pocket phones.The ONLY reason I couldn't give this a full five is that the letters on the touch screen are micro-sized and that could create some non-user-friendly animosity. It should also be noted that the device has minimal internal memory and without an SD micro card, you are very limited for MMS/Music/video.Over all a great product that charges quickly, has GREAT audio volume and when properly paired gives the user a sense of sci-fi superiority over typical mobile device users.Kudos! I have already talked the device up to a few friends and family, all of which are impressed and eager to try it themselves.

Reviews.Title: Mala Calidad
Reviews.Author: Enrique
Reviews.Content: Por cualquier cosa se desarma, materiales muy malos, funcionam3ento bueno.No lo recomiendo si va a utilizar mensajes de textomuy incomodas las letras
